com.amazon.ata.shoppingcart

Class ShoppingCart

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.amazon.ata.shoppingcart.ShoppingCart

  • public class ShoppingCart
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a customer's shopping cart, which they can add items to, specifying the quantity for each item. Item names are *case-sensitive*. For example, "Fire Engine" and "fire engine" are considered to be distinct item names for ShoppingCart.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ShoppingCart()
      Creates a new ShoppingCart, initially empty.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Adds the specified item to the ShoppingCart, with the given quantity, which must be at least one.
      ShoppingCartItem[] getItems()
      Returns an array of ShoppingCartItem currently in the ShoppingCart.
      boolean updateQuantity(java.lang.String itemName, int quantity)
      Updates the quantity for the specified item, setting it to the quantity provided, which must be at least zero.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShoppingCart

        public ShoppingCart()
        Creates a new ShoppingCart, initially empty.

    • Method Detail

      • addItem

        public boolean addItem(java.lang.String itemName,
                       int quantity)
        Adds the specified item to the ShoppingCart, with the given quantity, which must be at least one. If the specified item is already in the ShoppingCart, then, the cart's quantity will be updated so that it is the sum of what is already in the cart and the specified additional quantity.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The String name of the item to add to the ShoppingCart
        quantity - The number of the item that should be added to the ShoppingCart, expressed as an int
        Returns:
        true if adding the item to the cart succeeded, including case of adding quantity to existing item; false otherwise.

      • updateQuantity

        public boolean updateQuantity(java.lang.String itemName,
                              int quantity)
        Updates the quantity for the specified item, setting it to the quantity provided, which must be at least zero. If the quantity is zero, the item is removed from the ShoppingCart. If the specified item is not in the ShoppingCart, the request fails, and false is returned.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The String name of the item to update in the ShoppingCart
        quantity - The number of the item to be set to the ShoppingCart, expressed as an int
        Returns:
        True if updating the quantity for the item succeeded (including if removed from cart), false otherwise.

      • getItems

        public ShoppingCartItem[] getItems()
        Returns an array of ShoppingCartItem currently in the ShoppingCart.
        Returns:
        an array of ShoppingCartItem corresponding to the ShoppingCart's current contents
